abstract: Pres Obama, in interview with New York Times, seeks to reassure critics who feel he gave too much away in tentative nuclear agreement with Iran, defending deal as 'once in a lifetime opportunity'; restates commitment to defend Israel and details rigorous inspection process and policy for removing sanctions; Republicans have signaled that they will reserve further judgement until written deal is finalized, milestone that could still entail difficult negotiation.
lead_paragraph: In an interview, President Obama called last week’s preliminary agreement a “once in a lifetime opportunity” to curb the spread of nuclear weapons in a dangerous region while reassuring critics.

headline.main: President Obama Calls Preliminary Iran Nuclear Deal ‘Our Best Bet’
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls the Iran Deal ‘Our Best Bet’

snippet: In an interview, President Obama called last week’s preliminary agreement a “once in a lifetime opportunity” to curb the spread of nuclear weapons in a dangerous region while reassuring critics.
